param.name: ArduPlane:SERIAL0_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used on the main uart

param.name: ArduPlane:SERIAL3_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used on the telemetry port

param.name: ArduPlane:TELEM_DELAY
param.documentation: The amount of time (in seconds) to delay radio telemetry to prevent an Xbee bricking on power up

param.name: ArduPlane:KFF_PTCHCOMP
param.documentation: Adds pitch input to compensate for the loss of lift due to roll control. 0 = 0 %, 1 = 100%

param.name: ArduPlane:KFF_RDDRMIX
param.documentation: The amount of rudder mix to apply during aileron movement 0 = 0 %, 1 = 100%

param.name: ArduPlane:KFF_PTCH2THR
param.documentation: Pitch to throttle feed-forward gain.

param.name: ArduPlane:KFF_THR2PTCH
param.documentation: Throttle to pitch feed-forward gain.

param.name: ArduPlane:MANUAL_LEVEL
param.documentation: Setting this to Disabled(0) will enable autolevel on every boot. Setting it to Enabled(1) will do a calibration only when you tell it to

param.name: ArduPlane:STICK_MIXING
param.documentation: When enabled, this adds user stick input to the control surfaces in auto modes, allowing the user to have some degree of flight control without changing modes. There are two types of stick mixing available. If you set STICK_MIXING to 1 then it will use "fly by wire" mixing, which controls the roll and pitch in the same way that the FBWA mode does. This is the safest option if you usually fly ArduPlane in FBWA or FBWB mode. If you set STICK_MIXING to 2 then it will enable direct mixing mode, which is what the STABILIZE mode uses. That will allow for much more extreme maneuvers while in AUTO mode.

param.name: ArduPlane:TKOFF_THR_MINSPD
param.documentation: Minimum GPS ground speed in m/s before un-suppressing throttle in auto-takeoff. This is meant to be used for catapult launches where you want the motor to engage only after the plane leaves the catapult. Note that the GPS velocity will lag the real velocity by about 0.5seconds.

param.name: ArduPlane:TKOFF_THR_MINACC
param.documentation: Minimum forward acceleration in m/s/s before un-suppressing throttle in auto-takeoff. This is meant to be used for hand launches with a tractor style (front engine) plane. If this is set then the auto takeoff will only trigger if the pitch of the plane is between -30 and +45 degrees, and the roll is less than 30 degrees. This makes it less likely it will trigger due to carrying the plane with the nose down.

param.name: ArduPlane:LEVEL_ROLL_LIMIT
param.documentation: This controls the maximum bank angle in degrees during flight modes where level flight is desired, such as in the final stages of landing, and during auto takeoff. This should be a small angle (such as 5 degrees) to prevent a wing hitting the runway during takeoff or landing. Setting this to zero will completely disable heading hold on auto takeoff and final landing approach.

param.name: ArduPlane:land_pitch_cd
param.documentation: Used in autoland for planes without airspeed sensors in hundredths of a degree

param.name: ArduPlane:land_flare_alt
param.documentation: Altitude in autoland at which to lock heading and flare to the LAND_PITCH_CD pitch

param.name: ArduPlane:land_flare_sec
param.documentation: Time before landing point at which to lock heading and flare to the LAND_PITCH_CD pitch

param.name: ArduPlane:NAV_CONTROLLER
param.documentation: Which navigation controller to enable

param.name: ArduPlane:ALT_MIX
param.documentation: The percent of mixing between gps altitude and baro altitude. 0 = 100% gps, 1 = 100% baro

param.name: ArduPlane:ALT_CTRL_ALG
param.documentation: This sets what algorithm will be used for altitude control. The default is to select the algorithm based on whether airspeed is enabled. If you set it to 1, then the airspeed based algorithm won't be used for altitude control, but airspeed can be used for other flight control functions

param.name: ArduPlane:ALT_OFFSET
param.documentation: This is added to the target altitude in automatic flight. It can be used to add a global altitude offset to a mission, or to adjust for barometric pressure changes

param.name: ArduPlane:WP_RADIUS
param.documentation: Defines the distance from a waypoint, that when crossed indicates the wp has been hit.

param.name: ArduPlane:WP_LOITER_RAD
param.documentation: Defines the distance from the waypoint center, the plane will maintain during a loiter. If you set this value to a negative number then the default loiter direction will be counter-clockwise instead of clockwise.

param.name: ArduPlane:FENCE_ACTION
param.documentation: What to do on fence breach

param.name: ArduPlane:FENCE_TOTAL
param.documentation: Number of geofence points currently loaded

param.name: ArduPlane:FENCE_CHANNEL
param.documentation: RC Channel to use to enable geofence. PWM input above 1750 enables the geofence

param.name: ArduPlane:FENCE_MINALT
param.documentation: Minimum altitude allowed before geofence triggers

param.name: ArduPlane:FENCE_MAXALT
param.documentation: Maximum altitude allowed before geofence triggers

param.name: ArduPlane:ARSPD_FBW_MIN
param.documentation: Airspeed corresponding to minimum throttle in Fly By Wire B mode.

param.name: ArduPlane:ARSPD_FBW_MAX
param.documentation: Airspeed corresponding to maximum throttle in Fly By Wire B mode.

param.name: ArduPlane:FBWB_ELEV_REV
param.documentation: Reverse sense of elevator in FBWB. When set to 0 up elevator (pulling back on the stick) means to lower altitude. When set to 1, up elevator means to raise altitude.

param.humanName: Fly By Wire B altitude change rate
param.name: ArduPlane:FBWB_CLIMB_RATE
param.documentation: This sets the rate in m/s at which FBWB will change its target altitude for full elevator deflection. Note that the actual climb rate of the aircraft can be lower than this, depending on your airspeed and throttle control settings. If you have this parameter set to the default value of 2.0, then holding the elevator at maximum deflection for 10 seconds would change the target altitude by 20 meters.

param.name: ArduPlane:THR_MIN
param.documentation: The minimum throttle setting to which the autopilot will apply.

param.name: ArduPlane:THR_MAX
param.documentation: The maximum throttle setting to which the autopilot will apply.

param.name: ArduPlane:THR_SLEWRATE
param.documentation: maximum percentage change in throttle per second. A setting of 10 means to not change the throttle by more than 10% of the full throttle range in one second

param.name: ArduPlane:THR_SUPP_MAN
param.documentation: When throttle is supressed in auto mode it is normally forced to zero. If you enable this option, then while suppressed it will be manual throttle. This is useful on petrol engines to hold the idle throttle manually while waiting for takeoff

param.name: ArduPlane:THR_PASS_STAB
param.documentation: If this is set then when in STABILIZE or FBWA mode the throttle is a direct passthru from the transmitter. This means the THR_MIN and THR_MAX settings are not used in these modes. This is useful for petrol engines where you setup a throttle cut switch that suppresses the throttle below the normal minimum.

param.name: ArduPlane:THR_FAILSAFE
param.documentation: The throttle failsafe allows you to configure a software failsafe activated by a setting on the throttle input channel

param.name: ArduPlane:THR_FS_VALUE
param.documentation: The PWM level on channel 3 below which throttle sailsafe triggers

param.name: ArduPlane:TRIM_THROTTLE
param.documentation: The target percentage of throttle to apply for normal flight

param.name: ArduPlane:THROTTLE_NUDGE
param.documentation: When enabled, this uses the throttle input in auto-throttle modes to 'nudge' the throttle to higher or lower values

param.name: ArduPlane:FS_SHORT_ACTN
param.documentation: The action to take on a short (1 second) failsafe event

param.name: ArduPlane:FS_LONG_ACTN
param.documentation: The action to take on a long (20 second) failsafe event

param.name: ArduPlane:FS_GCS_ENABL
param.documentation: Enable ground control station telemetry failsafe. Failsafe will trigger after 20 seconds of no MAVLink heartbeat messages. WARNING: Enabling this option opens up the possibility of your plane going into failsafe mode and running the motor on the ground it it loses contact with your ground station. If this option is enabled on an electric plane then either use a separate motor arming switch or remove the propeller in any ground testing.

param.name: ArduPlane:FLTMODE_CH
param.documentation: RC Channel to use for flight mode control

param.name: ArduPlane:FLTMODE1
param.documentation: Flight mode for switch position 1 (910 to 1230 and above 2049)

param.name: ArduPlane:FLTMODE2
param.documentation: Flight mode for switch position 2 (1231 to 1360)

param.name: ArduPlane:FLTMODE3
param.documentation: Flight mode for switch position 3 (1361 to 1490)

param.name: ArduPlane:FLTMODE4
param.documentation: Flight mode for switch position 4 (1491 to 1620)

param.name: ArduPlane:FLTMODE5
param.documentation: Flight mode for switch position 5 (1621 to 1749)

param.name: ArduPlane:FLTMODE6
param.documentation: Flight mode for switch position 6 (1750 to 2049)

param.name: ArduPlane:LIM_ROLL_CD
param.documentation: The maximum commanded bank angle in either direction

param.name: ArduPlane:LIM_PITCH_MAX
param.documentation: The maximum commanded pitch up angle

param.name: ArduPlane:LIM_PITCH_MIN
param.documentation: The minimum commanded pitch down angle

param.name: ArduPlane:AUTO_TRIM
param.documentation: Set RC trim PWM levels to current levels when switching away from manual mode

param.name: ArduPlane:ELEVON_MIXING
param.documentation: Enable elevon mixing on both input and output

param.name: ArduPlane:ELEVON_REVERSE
param.documentation: Reverse elevon mixing

param.name: ArduPlane:ELEVON_CH1_REV
param.documentation: Reverse elevon channel 1

param.name: ArduPlane:ELEVON_CH2_REV
param.documentation: Reverse elevon channel 2

param.name: ArduPlane:VTAIL_OUTPUT
param.documentation: Enable VTail output in software. If enabled then the APM will provide software VTail mixing on the elevator and rudder channels. There are 4 different mixing modes available, which refer to the 4 ways the elevator can be mapped to the two VTail servos. Note that you must not use VTail output mixing with hardware pass-through of RC values, such as with channel 8 manual control on an APM1. So if you use an APM1 then set FLTMODE_CH to something other than 8 before you enable VTAIL_OUTPUT.

param.name: ArduPlane:SYS_NUM_RESETS
param.documentation: Number of APM board resets

param.name: ArduPlane:LOG_BITMASK
param.documentation: bitmap of log fields to enable

param.name: ArduPlane:RST_SWITCH_CH
param.documentation: RC channel to use to reset to last flight mode after geofence takeover.

param.name: ArduPlane:RST_MISSION_CH
param.documentation: RC channel to use to reset the mission to the first waypoint. When this channel goes above 1750 the mission is reset. Set RST_MISSION_CH to 0 to disable.

param.name: ArduPlane:TRIM_ARSPD_CM
param.documentation: Airspeed in cm/s to aim for when airspeed is enabled in auto mode

param.humanName: speed used for speed scaling calculations
param.name: ArduPlane:SCALING_SPEED
param.documentation: Airspeed in m/s to use when calculating surface speed scaling. Note that changing this value will affect all PID values

param.name: ArduPlane:MIN_GNDSPD_CM
param.documentation: Minimum ground speed in cm/s when under airspeed control

param.name: ArduPlane:TRIM_PITCH_CD
param.documentation: offset to add to pitch - used for trimming tail draggers

param.name: ArduPlane:ALT_HOLD_RTL
param.documentation: Return to launch target altitude

param.name: ArduPlane:ALT_HOLD_FBWCM
param.documentation: This is the minimum altitude in centimeters that FBWB will allow. If you attempt to descend below this altitude then the plane will level off. A value of zero means no limit.

param.name: ArduPlane:MAG_ENABLE
param.documentation: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the compass. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the compass

param.name: ArduPlane:APM_PER_VOLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to

param.name: ArduPlane:AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

param.name: ArduPlane:BATT_CAPACITY
param.documentation: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

param.name: ArduPlane:BATT_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Setting this to 0 ~ 13 will enable battery current sensing on pins A0 ~ A13.

param.name: ArduPlane:BATT_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Setting this to 0 ~ 13 will enable battery current sensing on pins A0 ~ A13.

param.name: ArduPlane:RSSI_PIN
param.documentation: This selects an analog pin for the receiver RSSI voltage. It assumes the voltage is 5V for max rssi, 0V for minimum

param.name: ArduPlane:INVERTEDFLT_CH
param.documentation: A RC input channel number to enable inverted flight. If this is non-zero then the APM will monitor the correcponding RC input channel and will enable inverted flight when the channel goes above 1750.

param.name: ArduPlane:HIL_SERVOS
param.documentation: This controls whether real servo controls are used in HIL mode. If you enable this then the APM will control the real servos in HIL mode. If disabled it will report servo values, but will not output to the real servos. Be careful that your motor and propeller are not connected if you enable this option.

param.name: ArduCopter:SYSID_SW_MREV
param.documentation: This value is incremented when changes are made to the eeprom format

param.name: ArduCopter:SYSID_SW_TYPE
param.documentation: This is used by the ground station to recognise the software type (eg ArduPlane vs ArduCopter)

param.name: ArduCopter:SYSID_THISMAV
param.documentation: Allows reconising the mavlink version

param.name: ArduCopter:SYSID_MYGCS
param.documentation: Allows restricting radio overrides to only come from my ground station

param.name: ArduCopter:SERIAL3_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used on the telemetry port

param.name: ArduCopter:TELEM_DELAY
param.documentation: The amount of time (in seconds) to delay radio telemetry to prevent an Xbee bricking on power up

param.name: ArduCopter:RTL_ALT
param.documentation: The minimum altitude the model will move to before Returning to Launch. Set to zero to return at current altitude.

param.name: ArduCopter:SONAR_ENABLE
param.documentation: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the sonar. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the sonar

param.name: ArduCopter:SONAR_TYPE
param.documentation: Used to adjust scaling to match the sonar used (only Maxbotix sonars are supported at this time)

param.name: ArduCopter:BATT_MONITOR
param.documentation: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_BATT_ENABLE
param.documentation: Controls whether failsafe will be invoked when battery voltage or current runs low

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_GPS_ENABLE
param.documentation: Controls whether failsafe will be invoked when gps signal is lost

param.name: ArduCopter:VOLT_DIVIDER
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin voltage * INPUT_VOLTS/1024 * VOLT_DIVIDER)

param.name: ArduCopter:AMP_PER_VOLT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage on the current sensing pin (BATT_CURR_PIN) to the actual current being consumed in amps (curr pin voltage * INPUT_VOLTS/1024 * AMP_PER_VOLT )

param.name: ArduCopter:BATT_CAPACITY
param.documentation: Battery capacity in milliamp-hours (mAh)

param.name: ArduCopter:MAG_ENABLE
param.documentation: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the compass. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the compass

param.name: ArduCopter:FLOW_ENABLE
param.documentation: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable optical flow. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable optical flow

param.name: ArduCopter:LOW_VOLT
param.documentation: Set this to the voltage you want to represent low voltage

param.name: ArduCopter:SUPER_SIMPLE
param.documentation: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable Super Simple Mode. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable Super Simple Mode

param.name: ArduCopter:RTL_ALT_FINAL
param.documentation: This is the altitude the vehicle will move to as the final stage of Returning to Launch or after completing a mission. Set to zero to land.

param.name: ArduCopter:BATT_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Setting this to 0 ~ 13 will enable battery current sensing on pins A0 ~ A13.

param.name: ArduCopter:BATT_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Setting this to 0 ~ 13 will enable battery current sensing on pins A0 ~ A13.

param.name: ArduCopter:RSSI_PIN
param.documentation: This selects an analog pin for the receiver RSSI voltage. It assumes the voltage is 5V for max rssi, 0V for minimum

param.name: ArduCopter:THR_ACC_ENABLE
param.documentation: This allows enabling and disabling the accelerometer based throttle controller. If disabled a velocity based controller is used.

param.name: ArduCopter:YAW_OVR_BEHAVE
param.documentation: Controls when autopilot takes back normal control of yaw after pilot overrides

param.name: ArduCopter:WP_TOTAL
param.documentation: Total number of commands in the mission stored in the eeprom. Do not update this parameter directly!

param.name: ArduCopter:WP_INDEX
param.documentation: The index number of the command that is currently being executed. Do not update this parameter directly!

param.name: ArduCopter:CIRCLE_RADIUS
param.documentation: Defines the radius of the circle the vehicle will fly when in Circle flight mode

param.name: ArduCopter:RTL_LOIT_TIME
param.documentation: Time (in milliseconds) to loiter above home before begining final descent

param.name: ArduCopter:LAND_SPEED
param.documentation: The descent speed for the final stage of landing in cm/s

param.humanName: Autopilot's min vertical speed (max descent) in cm/s
param.name: ArduCopter:AUTO_VELZ_MIN
param.documentation: The minimum vertical velocity (i.e. descent speed) the autopilot may request in cm/s

param.humanName: Auto pilot's max vertical speed in cm/s
param.name: ArduCopter:AUTO_VELZ_MAX
param.documentation: The maximum vertical velocity the autopilot may request in cm/s

param.name: ArduCopter:PILOT_VELZ_MAX
param.documentation: The maximum vertical velocity the pilot may request in cm/s

param.name: ArduCopter:THR_MIN
param.documentation: The minimum throttle that will be sent to the motors to keep them spinning

param.name: ArduCopter:THR_MAX
param.documentation: The maximum throttle that will be sent to the motors

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_THR_ENABLE
param.documentation: The throttle failsafe allows you to configure a software failsafe activated by a setting on the throttle input channel

values.value: Enabled Continue with Mission in Auto Mode

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_THR_VALUE
param.documentation: The PWM level on channel 3 below which throttle sailsafe triggers

param.name: ArduCopter:TRIM_THROTTLE
param.documentation: The autopilot's estimate of the throttle required to maintain a level hover. Calculated automatically from the pilot's throttle input while in stabilize mode

param.name: ArduCopter:THR_MID
param.documentation: The throttle output (0 ~ 1000) when throttle stick is in mid position. Used to scale the manual throttle so that the mid throttle stick position is close to the throttle required to hover

param.name: ArduCopter:FLTMODE1
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is <= 1230

param.name: ArduCopter:FLTMODE2
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1230, <= 1360

param.name: ArduCopter:FLTMODE3
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1360, <= 1490

param.name: ArduCopter:FLTMODE4
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1490, <= 1620

param.name: ArduCopter:FLTMODE5
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1620, <= 1749

param.name: ArduCopter:FLTMODE6
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >=1750

param.name: ArduCopter:SIMPLE
param.documentation: Bitmask which holds which flight modes use simple heading mode (eg bit 0 = 1 means Flight Mode 0 uses simple mode)

param.name: ArduCopter:LOG_BITMASK
param.documentation: 2 byte bitmap of log types to enable

param.name: ArduCopter:TOY_RATE
param.documentation: Controls yaw rate in Toy mode. Higher values will cause a slower yaw rate. Do not set to zero!

param.name: ArduCopter:ESC
param.documentation: Controls whether ArduCopter will enter ESC calibration on the next restart. Do not adjust this parameter manually.

param.name: ArduCopter:TUNE
param.documentation: Controls which parameters (normally PID gains) are being tuned with transmitter's channel 6 knob

param.name: ArduCopter:TUNE_LOW
param.documentation: The minimum value that will be applied to the parameter currently being tuned with the transmitter's channel 6 knob

param.name: ArduCopter:TUNE_HIGH
param.documentation: The maximum value that will be applied to the parameter currently being tuned with the transmitter's channel 6 knob

param.name: ArduCopter:FRAME
param.documentation: Controls motor mixing for multicopters. Not used for Tri or Traditional Helicopters.

param.name: ArduCopter:CH7_OPT
param.documentation: Select which function if performed when CH7 is above 1800 pwm

param.name: ArduCopter:AUTO_SLEW
param.documentation: This restricts the rate of change of the roll and pitch attitude commanded by the auto pilot

param.name: ArduCopter:RC_SPEED
param.documentation: This is the speed in Hertz that your ESCs will receive updates

param.name: ArduCopter:ACRO_P
param.documentation: Used to convert pilot roll, pitch and yaw input into a dssired rate of rotation in ACRO mode. Higher values mean faster rate of rotation.

param.name: ArduCopter:AXIS_ENABLE
param.documentation: Used to control whether acro mode actively maintains the current angle when control sticks are released (Enabled = maintains current angle)

param.name: ArduCopter:ACRO_BAL_ROLL
param.documentation: rate at which roll angle returns to level in acro mode

param.name: ArduCopter:ACRO_BAL_PITCH
param.documentation: rate at which pitch angle returns to level in acro mode

param.name: ArduCopter:ACRO_TRAINER
param.documentation: Set to 1 (Enabled) to make roll return to within 45 degrees of level automatically

param.name: ArduCopter:LED_MODE
param.documentation: bitmap to control the copter led mode

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller D gain
param.name: ArduCopter:RATE_RLL_P
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

param.humanName: Pitch axis rate controller D gain
param.name: ArduCopter:RATE_PIT_P
param.documentation: Pitch axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate

param.humanName: Yaw axis rate controller D gain
param.name: ArduCopter:RATE_YAW_P
param.documentation: Yaw axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate

param.humanName: Loiter latitude rate controller D gain
param.name: ArduCopter:LOITER_LAT_P
param.documentation: Loiter latitude rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired speed vs actual speed

param.name: ArduCopter:LOITER_LON_P
param.documentation: Loiter longitude rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired speed vs actual speed

param.name: ArduCopter:THR_RATE_P
param.documentation: Throttle rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired vertical speed vs actual speed

param.name: ArduCopter:THR_ACCEL_P
param.documentation: Throttle acceleration controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired vertical acceleration vs actual acceleration

param.humanName: Optical Flow based loiter controller roll axis D gain
param.name: ArduCopter:OF_RLL_P
param.documentation: Optical Flow based loiter controller roll axis D gain. Compensates for short-term change in speed in the roll direction

param.humanName: Optical Flow based loiter controller pitch axis D gain
param.name: ArduCopter:OF_PIT_P
param.documentation: Optical Flow based loiter controller pitch axis D gain. Compensates for short-term change in speed in the pitch direction

param.humanName: Roll axis stabilize controller I gain maximum
param.name: ArduCopter:STB_RLL_P
param.documentation: Roll axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum roll rate that the I term will generate

param.humanName: Pitch axis stabilize controller I gain maximum
param.name: ArduCopter:STB_PIT_P
param.documentation: Pitch axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum pitch rate that the I term will generate

param.humanName: Yaw axis stabilize controller I gain maximum
param.name: ArduCopter:STB_YAW_P
param.documentation: Yaw axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum yaw rate that the I term will generate

param.name: ArduCopter:THR_ALT_P
param.documentation: Altitude controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum climb rate rate that the I term will generate

param.humanName: Loiter latitude position controller I gain maximum
param.name: ArduCopter:HLD_LAT_P
param.documentation: Loiter latitude position controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum desired speed that the I term will generate

param.humanName: Loiter longitudeposition controller I gain maximum
param.name: ArduCopter:HLD_LON_P
param.documentation: Loiter longitudeposition controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum desired speed that the I term will generate

param.name: APMrover2:RSSI_PIN
param.documentation: This selects an analog pin for the receiver RSSI voltage. It assumes the voltage is 5V for max rssi, 0V for minimum

param.name: APMrover2:BATT_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Setting this to 0 ~ 13 will enable battery current sensing on pins A0 ~ A13.

param.name: APMrover2:BATT_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Setting this to 0 ~ 13 will enable battery current sensing on pins A0 ~ A13.

param.name: APMrover2:SYSID_THIS_MAV
param.documentation: ID used in MAVLink protocol to identify this vehicle

param.name: APMrover2:SYSID_MYGCS
param.documentation: ID used in MAVLink protocol to identify the controlling ground station

param.name: APMrover2:SERIAL0_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used on the first serial port

param.name: APMrover2:SERIAL3_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used on the telemetry port

param.name: APMrover2:TELEM_DELAY
param.documentation: The amount of time (in seconds) to delay radio telemetry to prevent an Xbee bricking on power up

param.name: APMrover2:MAG_ENABLED
param.documentation: This should be set to 1 if a compass is installed

param.name: APMrover2:BATT_MONITOR
param.documentation: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

param.name: APMrover2:VOLT_DIVIDER
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin voltage * INPUT_VOLTS/1024 * VOLT_DIVIDER)

param.name: APMrover2:AMP_PER_VOLT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage on the current sensing pin (BATT_CURR_PIN) to the actual current being consumed in amps (curr pin voltage * INPUT_VOLTS/1024 * AMP_PER_VOLT )

param.name: APMrover2:BATT_CAPACITY
param.documentation: Battery capacity in milliamp-hours (mAh)

param.name: APMrover2:XTRK_GAIN_SC
param.documentation: This controls how hard the Rover tries to follow the lines between waypoints, as opposed to driving directly to the next waypoint. The value is the scale between distance off the line and angle to meet the line (in Degrees * 100)

param.name: APMrover2:XTRK_ANGLE_CD
param.documentation: Maximum angle used to correct for track following.

param.name: APMrover2:AUTO_TRIGGER_PIN
param.documentation: pin number to use to trigger start of auto mode. If set to -1 then don't use a trigger, otherwise this is a pin number which if held low in auto mode will start the motor.

param.name: APMrover2:AUTO_KICKSTART
param.documentation: X acceleration in meters/second/second to use to trigger the motor start in auto mode. If set to zero then auto throttle starts immediately when the mode switch happens, otherwise the rover waits for the X acceleration to go above this value before it will start the motor

param.humanName: Target cruise speed in auto modes
param.name: APMrover2:CRUISE_SPEED
param.documentation: The target speed in auto missions.

param.name: APMrover2:SPEED_TURN_GAIN
param.documentation: The percentage to reduce the throttle while turning. If this is 100% then the target speed is not reduced while turning. If this is 50% then the target speed is reduced in proportion to the turn rate, with a reduction of 50% when the steering is maximally deflected.

param.humanName: Distance to turn to start reducing speed
param.name: APMrover2:SPEED_TURN_DIST
param.documentation: The distance to the next turn at which the rover reduces its target speed by the SPEED_TURN_GAIN

param.name: APMrover2:CH7_OPTION
param.documentation: What to do use channel 7 for

param.name: APMrover2:THR_MIN
param.documentation: The minimum throttle setting to which the autopilot will apply. This is mostly useful for rovers with internal combustion motors, to prevent the motor from cutting out in auto mode.

param.name: APMrover2:THR_MAX
param.documentation: The maximum throttle setting to which the autopilot will apply. This can be used to prevent overheating a ESC or motor on an electric rover.

param.name: APMrover2:CRUISE_THROTTLE
param.documentation: The base throttle percentage to use in auto mode. The CRUISE_SPEED parameter controls the target speed, but the rover starts with the CRUISE_THROTTLE setting as the initial estimate for how much throttle is needed to achieve that speed. It then adjusts the throttle based on how fast the rover is actually going.

param.name: APMrover2:THR_SLEWRATE
param.documentation: maximum percentage change in throttle per second. A setting of 10 means to not change the throttle by more than 10% of the full throttle range in one second. A value of zero means no limit.

param.name: APMrover2:SKID_STEER_OUT
param.documentation: Set this to 1 for skid steering controlled rovers (tank track style). When enabled, servo1 is used for the left track control, servo3 is used for right track control

param.name: APMrover2:SKID_STEER_IN
param.documentation: Set this to 1 for skid steering input rovers (tank track style in RC controller). When enabled, servo1 is used for the left track control, servo3 is used for right track control

param.name: APMrover2:FS_ACTION
param.documentation: What to do on a failsafe event

param.name: APMrover2:FS_TIMEOUT
param.documentation: How long a failsafe event need to happen for before we trigger the failsafe action

param.name: APMrover2:FS_THR_ENABLE
param.documentation: The throttle failsafe allows you to configure a software failsafe activated by a setting on the throttle input channel to a low value. This can be used to detect the RC transmitter going out of range. Failsafe will be triggered when the throttle channel goes below the FS_THR_VALUE for FS_TIMEOUT seconds.

param.name: APMrover2:FS_THR_VALUE
param.documentation: The PWM level on channel 3 below which throttle sailsafe triggers.

param.name: APMrover2:FS_GCS_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable ground control station telemetry failsafe. When enabled the Rover will execute the FS_ACTION when it fails to receive MAVLink heartbeat packets for FS_TIMEOUT seconds.

param.name: APMrover2:SONAR_TRIGGER_CM
param.documentation: The distance from an obstacle in centimeters at which the sonar triggers a turn to avoid the obstacle

param.name: APMrover2:SONAR_TURN_ANGLE
param.documentation: The course deviation in degrees to apply while avoiding an obstacle detected with the sonar. A positive number means to turn right, and a negative angle means to turn left.

param.name: APMrover2:SONAR_TURN_TIME
param.documentation: The amount of time in seconds to apply the SONAR_TURN_ANGLE after detecting an obstacle.

param.name: APMrover2:SONAR_DEBOUNCE
param.documentation: The number of 50Hz sonar hits needed to trigger an obstacle avoidance event. If you get a lot of false sonar events then raise this number, but if you make it too large then it will cause lag in detecting obstacles, which could cause you go hit the obstacle.

param.name: APMrover2:MODE_CH
param.documentation: RC Channel to use for driving mode control

param.name: APMrover2:MODE1
param.documentation: Driving mode for switch position 1 (910 to 1230 and above 2049)

param.name: APMrover2:MODE2
param.documentation: Driving mode for switch position 2 (1231 to 1360)

param.name: APMrover2:MODE3
param.documentation: Driving mode for switch position 3 (1361 to 1490)

param.name: APMrover2:MODE4
param.documentation: Driving mode for switch position 4 (1491 to 1620)

param.name: APMrover2:MODE5
param.documentation: Driving mode for switch position 5 (1621 to 1749)

param.name: APMrover2:MODE6
param.documentation: Driving mode for switch position 6 (1750 to 2049)

param.name: APMrover2:WP_RADIUS
param.documentation: The distance in meters from a waypoint when we consider the waypoint has been reached. This determines when the rover will turn along the next waypoint path.

param.name: CAM_TRIGG_TYPE
param.documentation: how to trigger the camera to take a picture

param.humanName: Duration that shutter is held open
param.name: CAM_DURATION
param.documentation: How long the shutter will be held open in 10ths of a second (i.e. enter 10 for 1second, 50 for 5seconds)

param.name: CAM_SERVO_ON
param.documentation: PWM value to move servo to when shutter is activated

param.name: CAM_SERVO_OFF
param.documentation: PWM value to move servo to when shutter is deactivated

param.humanName: Compass offsets on the Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS_X
param.documentation: Offset to be added to the compass z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.name: COMPASS_DEC
param.documentation: An angle to compensate between the true north and magnetic north

param.name: COMPASS_LEARN
param.documentation: Enable or disable the automatic learning of compass offsets

param.name: COMPASS_USE
param.documentation: Enable or disable the use of the compass (instead of the GPS) for determining heading

param.name: COMPASS_AUTODEC
param.documentation: Enable or disable the automatic calculation of the declination based on gps location

param.name: COMPASS_MOTCT
param.documentation: Set motor interference compensation type to disabled, throttle or current

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation for body frame Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT_X
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference

param.name: INS_PRODUCT_ID
param.documentation: Which type of IMU is installed (read-only)

param.name: INS_ACCOFFS_X
param.documentation: Accelerometer offsets of Z axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

param.name: INS_GYROFFS_X
param.documentation: Gyro sensor offsets of Z axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

param.name: INS_MPU6K_FILTER
param.documentation: Filter frequency to ask the MPU6000 to apply to samples. This can be set to a lower value to try to cope with very high vibration levels in aircraft. The default value on ArduPlane, APMrover2 and ArduCopter is 20Hz. This option takes effect on the next reboot or gyro initialisation

param.name: AHRS_GPS_GAIN
param.documentation: This controls how how much to use the GPS to correct the attitude. This should never be set to zero for a plane as it would result in the plane losing control in turns. For a plane please use the default value of 1.0.

param.name: AHRS_GPS_USE
param.documentation: This controls whether to use dead-reckoning or GPS based navigation. If set to 0 then the GPS won't be used for navigation, and only dead reckoning will be used. A value of zero should never be used for normal flight.

param.name: AHRS_YAW_P
param.documentation: This controls the weight the compass or GPS has on the heading. A higher value means the heading will track the yaw source (GPS or compass) more rapidly.

param.name: AHRS_RP_P
param.documentation: This controls how fast the accelerometers correct the attitude

param.name: AHRS_WIND_MAX
param.documentation: This sets the maximum allowable difference between ground speed and airspeed. This allows the plane to cope with a failing airspeed sensor. A value of zero means to use the airspeed as is.

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_X
param.documentation: Not Used

param.name: AHRS_ORIENTATION
param.documentation: Overall board orientation relative to the standard orientation for the board type. This rotates the IMU and compass readings to allow the board to be oriented in your vehicle at any 90 or 45 degree angle. This option takes affect on next boot. After changing you will need to re-level your vehicle.

param.humanName: AHRS Velocity Complmentary Filter Beta Coefficient
param.name: AHRS_COMP_BETA
param.documentation: This controls the time constant for the cross-over frequency used to fuse AHRS (airspeed and heading) and GPS data to estimate ground velocity. Time constant is 0.1/beta. A larger time constant will use GPS data less and a small time constant will use air data less.

param.name: ARSPD_ENABLE
param.documentation: enable airspeed sensor

param.name: ARSPD_USE
param.documentation: use airspeed for flight control

param.name: ARSPD_OFFSET
param.documentation: Airspeed calibration offset

param.name: ARSPD_RATIO
param.documentation: Airspeed calibration ratio

param.name: NAVL1_PERIOD
param.documentation: Period in seconds of L1 tracking loop. This needs to be larger for less responsive airframes. The default of 30 is very conservative, and for most RC aircraft will lead to slow and lazy turns. For smaller more agile aircraft a value closer to 20 is appropriate. When tuning, change this value in small increments, as a value that is much too small (say 5 or 10 below the right value) can lead to very radical turns, and a risk of stalling.

param.name: NAVL1_DAMPING
param.documentation: Damping ratio for L1 control. Increase this if you are getting overshoot in path tracking.

param.name: MNT_MODE
param.documentation: Camera or antenna mount operation mode

param.humanName: Mount yaw/pan angle when in retracted position
param.name: MNT_RETRACT_X
param.documentation: Mount yaw/pan angle when in retracted position

param.humanName: Mount pan/yaw angle when in neutral position
param.name: MNT_NEUTRAL_X
param.documentation: Mount pan/yaw angle when in neutral position

param.humanName: Mount pan/yaw angle command from groundstation
param.name: MNT_CONTROL_X
param.documentation: Mount pan/yaw angle when in MavLink or RC control operation mode

param.name: MNT_STAB_TILT
param.documentation: enable tilt/pitch stabilisation relative to Earth

param.name: MNT_STAB_PAN
param.documentation: enable pan/yaw stabilisation relative to Earth

param.name: MNT_RC_IN_ROLL
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control roll movements

param.name: MNT_ANGMIN_ROL
param.documentation: Minimum physical roll angular position of mount.

param.name: MNT_ANGMAX_ROL
param.documentation: Maximum physical roll angular position of the mount

param.name: MNT_RC_IN_TILT
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control tilt (pitch) movements

param.name: MNT_ANGMIN_TIL
param.documentation: Minimum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of mount.

param.name: MNT_ANGMAX_TIL
param.documentation: Maximum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of the mount

param.name: MNT_RC_IN_PAN
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control pan (yaw) movements

param.name: MNT_ANGMIN_PAN
param.documentation: Minimum physical pan (yaw) angular position of mount.

param.name: MNT_ANGMAX_PAN
param.documentation: Maximum physical pan (yaw) angular position of the mount

param.name: MNT_JSTICK_SPD
param.documentation: 0 for position control, small for low speeds, 100 for max speed. A good general value is 10 which gives a movement speed of 3 degrees per second.

param.name: MNT2_MODE
param.documentation: Camera or antenna mount operation mode

param.humanName: Mount yaw/pan angle when in retracted position
param.name: MNT2_RETRACT_X

param.humanName: Mount pan/yaw angle when in neutral position
param.name: MNT2_NEUTRAL_X

param.name: MNT2_STAB_TILT

param.name: MNT2_STAB_PAN
param.documentation: enable pan/yaw stabilisation relative to Earth

param.name: MNT2_RC_IN_ROLL
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control roll movements

param.name: MNT2_ANGMIN_ROL
param.documentation: Minimum physical roll angular position of mount.

param.name: MNT2_ANGMAX_ROL
param.documentation: Maximum physical roll angular position of the mount

param.name: MNT2_RC_IN_TILT
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control tilt (pitch) movements

param.name: MNT2_ANGMIN_TIL
param.documentation: Minimum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of mount.

param.name: MNT2_ANGMAX_TIL

param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control pan (yaw) movements

param.documentation: How long the shutter will be held open in 10ths of a second (i.e. enter 10 for 1second, 50 for 5seconds)

param.name: CAM_SERVO_ON
param.documentation: PWM value to move servo to when shutter is activated

param.name: CAM_SERVO_OFF
param.documentation: PWM value to move servo to when shutter is deactivated

param.humanName: Compass offsets on the Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS_X
param.documentation: Offset to be added to the compass z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.name: COMPASS_DEC
param.documentation: An angle to compensate between the true north and magnetic north

param.name: COMPASS_LEARN
param.documentation: Enable or disable the automatic learning of compass offsets

param.name: COMPASS_USE
param.documentation: Enable or disable the use of the compass (instead of the GPS) for determining heading

param.name: COMPASS_AUTODEC
param.documentation: Enable or disable the automatic calculation of the declination based on gps location

param.name: COMPASS_MOTCT
param.documentation: Set motor interference compensation type to disabled, throttle or current

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation for body frame Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT_X
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference

param.name: INAV_TC_XY
param.documentation: Time constant for GPS and accel mixing. Higher TC decreases GPS impact on position estimate

param.name: INAV_TC_Z
param.documentation: Time constant for baro and accel mixing. Higher TC decreases barometers impact on altitude estimate

param.name: WPNAV_SPEED
param.documentation: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain during a WP mission

param.name: WPNAV_RADIUS
param.documentation: Defines the distance from a waypoint, that when crossed indicates the wp has been hit.

param.name: SR0_SPEED
param.documentation: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain during a WP mission

param.name: SR0_RADIUS
param.documentation: Defines the distance from a waypoint, that when crossed indicates the wp has been hit.

param.name: SR3_SPEED
param.documentation: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain during a WP mission

param.name: SR3_RADIUS
param.documentation: Defines the distance from a waypoint, that when crossed indicates the wp has been hit.

param.name: AHRS_GPS_GAIN
param.documentation: This controls how how much to use the GPS to correct the attitude. This should never be set to zero for a plane as it would result in the plane losing control in turns. For a plane please use the default value of 1.0.

param.name: AHRS_GPS_USE
param.documentation: This controls whether to use dead-reckoning or GPS based navigation. If set to 0 then the GPS won't be used for navigation, and only dead reckoning will be used. A value of zero should never be used for normal flight.

param.name: AHRS_YAW_P
param.documentation: This controls the weight the compass or GPS has on the heading. A higher value means the heading will track the yaw source (GPS or compass) more rapidly.

param.name: AHRS_RP_P
param.documentation: This controls how fast the accelerometers correct the attitude

param.name: AHRS_WIND_MAX
param.documentation: This sets the maximum allowable difference between ground speed and airspeed. This allows the plane to cope with a failing airspeed sensor. A value of zero means to use the airspeed as is.

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_X
param.documentation: Not Used

param.name: AHRS_ORIENTATION
param.documentation: Overall board orientation relative to the standard orientation for the board type. This rotates the IMU and compass readings to allow the board to be oriented in your vehicle at any 90 or 45 degree angle. This option takes affect on next boot. After changing you will need to re-level your vehicle.

param.humanName: AHRS Velocity Complmentary Filter Beta Coefficient
param.name: AHRS_COMP_BETA
param.documentation: This controls the time constant for the cross-over frequency used to fuse AHRS (airspeed and heading) and GPS data to estimate ground velocity. Time constant is 0.1/beta. A larger time constant will use GPS data less and a small time constant will use air data less.

param.name: MNT_MODE
param.documentation: Camera or antenna mount operation mode

param.humanName: Mount yaw/pan angle when in retracted position
param.name: MNT_RETRACT_X
param.documentation: Mount yaw/pan angle when in retracted position

param.humanName: Mount pan/yaw angle when in neutral position
param.name: MNT_NEUTRAL_X
param.documentation: Mount pan/yaw angle when in neutral position

param.humanName: Mount pan/yaw angle command from groundstation
param.name: MNT_CONTROL_X
param.documentation: Mount pan/yaw angle when in MavLink or RC control operation mode

param.name: MNT_STAB_TILT
param.documentation: enable tilt/pitch stabilisation relative to Earth

param.name: MNT_STAB_PAN
param.documentation: enable pan/yaw stabilisation relative to Earth

param.name: MNT_RC_IN_ROLL
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control roll movements

param.name: MNT_ANGMIN_ROL
param.documentation: Minimum physical roll angular position of mount.

param.name: MNT_ANGMAX_ROL
param.documentation: Maximum physical roll angular position of the mount

param.name: MNT_RC_IN_TILT
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control tilt (pitch) movements

param.name: MNT_ANGMIN_TIL
param.documentation: Minimum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of mount.

param.name: MNT_ANGMAX_TIL
param.documentation: Maximum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of the mount

param.name: MNT_RC_IN_PAN
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control pan (yaw) movements

param.name: MNT_ANGMIN_PAN
param.documentation: Minimum physical pan (yaw) angular position of mount.

param.name: MNT_ANGMAX_PAN
param.documentation: Maximum physical pan (yaw) angular position of the mount

param.name: MNT_JSTICK_SPD
param.documentation: 0 for position control, small for low speeds, 100 for max speed. A good general value is 10 which gives a movement speed of 3 degrees per second.

param.name: MNT2_MODE
param.documentation: Camera or antenna mount operation mode

param.humanName: Mount yaw/pan angle when in retracted position
param.name: MNT2_RETRACT_X
param.documentation: Mount yaw/pan angle when in retracted position

param.humanName: Mount pan/yaw angle when in neutral position
param.name: MNT2_NEUTRAL_X
param.documentation: Mount pan/yaw angle when in neutral position

param.humanName: Mount pan/yaw angle command from groundstation
param.name: MNT2_CONTROL_X
param.documentation: Mount pan/yaw angle when in MavLink or RC control operation mode

param.name: MNT2_STAB_TILT
param.documentation: enable tilt/pitch stabilisation relative to Earth

param.name: MNT2_STAB_PAN
param.documentation: enable pan/yaw stabilisation relative to Earth

param.name: MNT2_RC_IN_ROLL
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control roll movements

param.name: MNT2_ANGMIN_ROL
param.documentation: Minimum physical roll angular position of mount.

param.name: MNT2_ANGMAX_ROL
param.documentation: Maximum physical roll angular position of the mount

param.name: MNT2_RC_IN_TILT
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control tilt (pitch) movements

param.name: MNT2_ANGMIN_TIL
param.documentation: Minimum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of mount.

param.name: MNT2_ANGMAX_TIL
param.documentation: Maximum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of the mount

param.name: MNT2_RC_IN_PAN
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control pan (yaw) movements

param.name: MNT2_ANGMIN_PAN
param.documentation: Minimum physical pan (yaw) angular position of mount.

param.name: MNT2_ANGMAX_PAN
param.documentation: Maximum physical pan (yaw) angular position of the mount

param.name: MNT2_JSTICK_SPD
param.documentation: 0 for position control, small for low speeds, 100 for max speed. A good general value is 10 which gives a movement speed of 3 degrees per second.

param.name: LIM_ENABLED
param.documentation: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the limits system

param.name: LIM_REQUIRED
param.documentation: Setting this to 1 will enable the limits pre-arm checklist

param.name: LIM_DEBUG
param.documentation: Setting this to 1 will turn on debugging messages on the console and via MAVLink STATUSTEXT messages

param.name: LIM_SAFETIME
param.documentation: Automatic return of controls to pilot. Set to 0 to disable (full RTL) or a number of seconds after complete recovery to return the controls to the pilot in STABILIZE

param.name: LIM_CHANNEL
param.documentation: Channel for Limits on/off control. If channel exceeds LIMITS_ENABLE_PWM, it turns limits on, and vice-versa.

param.name: LIM_RECMODE
param.documentation: Select how Limits should "recover". Set to 0 for RTL-like mode, where the vehicle navigates back to home until it is "safe". Set to 1, for bounce-mode, where the vehicle will hold position when it hits a limit. RTL mode is better for large fenced areas, Bounce mode for smaller spaces. Note: RTL mode will cause the vehicle to yaw 180 degrees (turn around) to navigate towards home when it hits a limit.

param.name: LIM_GPSLCK_ON
param.documentation: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the gpslock. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the gpslock

param.name: LIM_GPSLCK_REQ
param.documentation: Setting this to Enabled(1) will make being inside the gpslock a required check before arming the vehicle.

param.name: LIM_FNC_ON
param.documentation: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the geofence. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the geofence

param.name: LIM_FNC_REQ
param.documentation: Setting this to Enabled(1) will make being inside the geofence a required check before arming the vehicle.

param.name: LIM_FNC_SMPL
param.documentation: "Simple" geofence (enabled - 1) is based on a radius from the home position, "Complex" (disabled - 0) define a complex fence by lat/long positions

param.name: LIM_FNC_RAD
param.documentation: Radius of fenced area in meters. A value of 20 creates a 20-meter radius circle (40-meter diameter) from the home point.

param.name: LIM_FNC_TOT
param.documentation: Total number of geofence points. This parameter should not be updated manually

param.name: LIM_ALT_ON
param.documentation: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the altitude. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the altitude

param.name: LIM_ALT_REQ
param.documentation: Setting this to Enabled(1) will make being inside the altitude a required check before arming the vehicle.

param.name: LIM_ALT_MIN
param.documentation: Minimum Altitude. Zero to disable. Sets a "floor" that your vehicle will try to stay above. IF the vehicle is crossing the threshold at speed, it will take a while to recover, so give yourself enough room. Caution: minimum altitude limits can cause unexpected behaviour, such as inability to land, or sudden takeoff. Read the wiki instructions before setting.

param.name: LIM_ALT_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum Altitude. Zero to disable. Sets a "ceiling" that your vehicle will try to stay below. IF the vehicle is crossing the threshold at speed, it will take a while to recover.

param.name: H_SV1_POS
param.documentation: This is the angular location of swash servo #1.

param.name: H_SV2_POS
param.documentation: This is the angular location of swash servo #2.

param.name: H_SV3_POS
param.documentation: This is the angular location of swash servo #3.

param.name: H_ROL_MAX
param.documentation: This is the maximum allowable roll of the swash plate.

param.name: H_PIT_MAX
param.documentation: This is the maximum allowable pitch of the swash plate.

param.name: H_COL_MIN
param.documentation: This controls the lowest possible servo position for the swashplate.

param.name: H_COL_MAX
param.documentation: This controls the highest possible servo position for the swashplate.

param.name: H_COL_MID
param.documentation: This is the swash servo position corresponding to zero collective pitch (or zero lift for Assymetrical blades).

param.name: H_GYR_ENABLE
param.documentation: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable an external rudder gyro control which means outputting a gain on channel 7 and using a simpler heading control algorithm. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the external gyro gain on channel 7 and revert to a more complex yaw control algorithm.

param.name: H_SWASH_TYPE
param.documentation: Setting this to 0 will configure for a 3-servo CCPM. Setting this to 1 will configure for mechanically mixed "H1".

param.name: H_GYR_GAIN
param.documentation: This is the PWM which is passed to the external gyro when external gyro is enabled.

param.name: H_SV_MAN
param.documentation: Setting this to Enabled(1) will pass radio inputs directly to servos. Setting this to Disabled(0) will enable Arducopter control of servos. This is only meant to be used by the Mission Planner using swash plate set-up.

param.name: H_PHANG
param.documentation: This corrects for phase angle errors of the helicopter main rotor head. For example if pitching the swash forward also induces a roll, that effect can be offset with this parameter.

param.name: H_COLYAW
param.documentation: This is a feed-forward compensation to automatically add rudder input when collective pitch is increased.

param.name: H_GOV_SETPOINT
param.documentation: This is the PWM which is passed to the external motor governor when external governor is enabled.

param.name: H_RSC_MODE
param.documentation: This sets which ESC control mode is active.

param.name: H_RSC_RATE
param.documentation: This sets the time the RSC takes to ramp up to full speed (Soft Start).

param.name: H_FLYBAR_MODE
param.documentation: This sets which acro mode is active. (0) is Flybarless (1) is Mechanical Flybar

param.name: H_STAB_COL_MIN
param.documentation: This is the minimum collective setpoint in Stabilize Mode

param.name: H_STAB_COL_MAX
param.documentation: This is the maximum collective setpoint in Stabilize Mode

param.name: MOT_TB_RATIO
param.documentation: Not Used. Will control the speed of the top motors vs bottom motors on frames such as the Octo-Quad and Y6

param.name: MOT_TCRV_ENABLE
param.documentation: Controls whether a curve is used to linearize the thrust produced by the motors

param.name: MOT_TCRV_MIDPCT
param.documentation: Set the pwm position that produces half the maximum thrust of the motors

param.name: MOT_TCRV_MAXPCT
param.documentation: Set to the lowest pwm position that produces the maximum thrust of the motors. Most motors produce maximum thrust below the maximum pwm value that they accept.

param.name: SONAR_PIN
param.documentation: Analog pin that sonar is connected to. Use pin number 127 for an APM1 Oilpan

param.name: SONAR_SCALING
param.documentation: Scaling factor between sonar reading and distance. For the linear and inverted functions this is in meters per volt. For the hyperbolic function the units are meterVolts.

param.name: SONAR_OFFSET
param.documentation: Offset in volts for zero distance

param.name: SONAR_FUNCTION
param.documentation: Control over what function is used to calculate distance. For a linear function, the distance is (voltage-offset)*scaling. For a inverted function the distance is (offset-voltage)*scaling. For a hyperbolic function the distance is scaling/(voltage-offset). The functions return the distance in meters.

param.name: SONAR_MIN_CM
param.documentation: minimum distance in centimeters that sonar can reliably read

param.name: SONAR_MAX_CM
param.documentation: maximum distance in centimeters that sonar can reliably read

param.name: SONAR_ENABLE
param.documentation: set to 1 to enable this sonar

param.name: INS_PRODUCT_ID
param.documentation: Which type of IMU is installed (read-only)

param.name: INS_ACCOFFS_X
param.documentation: Accelerometer offsets of Z axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

param.name: INS_GYROFFS_X
param.documentation: Gyro sensor offsets of Z axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

param.name: INS_MPU6K_FILTER
param.documentation: Filter frequency to ask the MPU6000 to apply to samples. This can be set to a lower value to try to cope with very high vibration levels in aircraft. The default value on ArduPlane, APMrover2 and ArduCopter is 20Hz. This option takes effect on the next reboot or gyro initialisation

param.name: AHRS_GPS_GAIN
param.documentation: This controls how how much to use the GPS to correct the attitude. This should never be set to zero for a plane as it would result in the plane losing control in turns. For a plane please use the default value of 1.0.

param.name: AHRS_GPS_USE
param.documentation: This controls whether to use dead-reckoning or GPS based navigation. If set to 0 then the GPS won't be used for navigation, and only dead reckoning will be used. A value of zero should never be used for normal flight.

param.name: AHRS_YAW_P
param.documentation: This controls the weight the compass or GPS has on the heading. A higher value means the heading will track the yaw source (GPS or compass) more rapidly.

param.name: AHRS_RP_P
param.documentation: This controls how fast the accelerometers correct the attitude

param.name: AHRS_WIND_MAX
param.documentation: This sets the maximum allowable difference between ground speed and airspeed. This allows the plane to cope with a failing airspeed sensor. A value of zero means to use the airspeed as is.

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_X
param.documentation: Not Used

param.name: AHRS_ORIENTATION
param.documentation: Overall board orientation relative to the standard orientation for the board type. This rotates the IMU and compass readings to allow the board to be oriented in your vehicle at any 90 or 45 degree angle. This option takes affect on next boot. After changing you will need to re-level your vehicle.

param.humanName: AHRS Velocity Complmentary Filter Beta Coefficient
param.name: AHRS_COMP_BETA
param.documentation: This controls the time constant for the cross-over frequency used to fuse AHRS (airspeed and heading) and GPS data to estimate ground velocity. Time constant is 0.1/beta. A larger time constant will use GPS data less and a small time constant will use air data less.
